item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
That completely depends on the database at hand. You’ll have to monitor the fragmentation in order to determine the need for rebuilds or reorganization steps.

Give you an example: I have one database that is around 100GB. In this database I update stats for about 20 tables every 4 hours and then nightly rebuilds. These types of work tables require very active maintenance to keep them running well but the lock scenario of course is a consideration. Some other indexes on large archived tables and or static tables get rebuild monthly just because there is no need.
